devdoc.author: Enrique Piqueras - <enrique@kleros.io>  Arbitrable interface.  When developing arbitrable contracts, we need to:  -Define the action taken when a ruling is received by the contract. We should do so in executeRuling.  -Allow dispute creation. For this a function must:      -Call arbitrator.createDispute.value(_fee)(_choices,_extraData);      -Create the event Dispute(_arbitrator,_disputeID,_rulingOptions);

Dispute(address,uint256,uint256,uint256).details: To be emmited when a dispute is created to link the correct meta-evidence to the disputeID

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.
params._evidenceGroupID: Unique identifier of the evidence group that is linked to this dispute.

Evidence(address,uint256,address,string).details: To be raised when evidence are submitted. Should point to the ressource (evidences are not to be stored on chain due to gas considerations).

params._evidence: A URI to the evidence JSON file whose name should be its keccak256 hash followed by .json.
params._evidenceGroupID: Unique identifier of the evidence group the evidence belongs to.
params._party: The address of the party submiting the evidence. Note that 0x0 refers to evidence not submitted by any party.

MetaEvidence(uint256,string).details: To be emmited when meta-evidence is submitted.

params._evidence: A link to the meta-evidence JSON.

Ruling(address,uint256,uint256).details: To be raised when a ruling is given.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: Give a ruling for a dispute. Must be called by the arbitrator.  The purpose of this function is to ensure that the address calling it has the right to rule on the contract.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for "Not able/wanting to make a decision".

devdoc.title: IArbitrable
